channel.title: Hmmmmm, a bug with hp?
channel.description: ok i have it so u start with 10hp, but when you level, it flashes to 11/11, then goes to 10/11, same everytime you leve, goes to 98/98, then to 10/98. and when you logout then in, it resets to 10. how to fix? i have the refresh skill void, tried putting it in process, 1: dont work 2: lagged like a motha.

item.title: Hmmmmm, a bug with hp?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ShadowShaft, post:2, topic:120503”]you do have

int Hitpointslvl = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);

?
&&

above

playerItems = loadgame.playerItem; playerItemsN = loadgame.playerItemN; playerEquipment = loadgame.playerEquipment; playerEquipmentN = loadgame.playerEquipmentN; bankItems = loadgame.bankItems; bankItemsN = loadgame.bankItemsN; playerLevel = loadgame.playerLevel; playerXP = loadgame.playerXP;

if(NewHP < 1) { playerLevel[playerHitpoints] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]); }[/quote]
Yeah that should work fine.
I think the problem here is with this void:

	public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
		int points = 0;
		int output = 0;

		for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
			points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 150.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
			output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
			if (output >= exp) {
				return lvl;
			}
		}
		return 99;
	}

Something in it isnt returning the right value.[br][size=1]Posted on: July 06, 2007, 06:35:58 PM[/size][hr]Actually I’ve been comparing this to my Lunar Spellbook, and I think you should try this out.

Search for

levelup(3);

And you should see something like this

         if (Hitpoints < getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) {
            playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
            levelup(3);
            updateRequired = true;
            appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
         }

Now try adding this piece of code after

sendFrame126(""+playerLevel[3]+"", 4004);

the levelup(3); part.

Tell me if this works.

Read full topic
